Description: Fragment of a silver ring; made of spirally curved silver wire, parts of four turns survive.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: Not mentioned in the Excavations in Cyprus or Walter's letter to the Principal Librarian of the Museum in 1895, but is listed in the original notebook 'Notes at Curium' (Bailey & Hockey 2001, p. 111, cat. no. 9b).
Bibliographic references: Bailey & Hockey 2001 / 'New objects' from British Museum Tomb 73 at Curium (p.111, cat. no. 9b & fig. 9.7)
